trans-unit.source: Pauses script execution until a given process does not exist.

seg-source.mrk: Pauses script execution until a given process does not exist.

target.mrk: Pauses script execution until a given process does not exist.

seg-source.mrk: Parameters

target.mrk: Parameters

trans-unit.source: The name or PID of the process to check.

seg-source.mrk: The name or PID of the process to check.

target.mrk: The name or PID of the process to check.

trans-unit.source: [optional] Specifies how long to wait (in seconds). Default is to wait indefinitely.

seg-source.mrk: [optional]
Specifies how long to wait (in seconds).
Default is to wait indefinitely.

target.mrk: [optional]
Specifies how long to wait (in seconds).
Default is to wait indefinitely.

seg-source.mrk: Return Value

target.mrk: Return Value

trans-unit.source: 1 and sets @extended to the exit code of the process.

seg-source.mrk: 1 and sets @extended to the exit code of the process.

target.mrk: 1 and sets @extended to the exit code of the process.

trans-unit.source: 0 if the wait timed out. On invalid PID the @error flag is set to non-zero and @extended is set to 0xCCCCCCCC.

seg-source.mrk: 0 if the wait timed out.
On invalid PID the @error flag is set to non-zero and @extended is set to 0xCCCCCCCC.

target.mrk: 0 if the wait timed out.
On invalid PID the @error flag is set to non-zero and @extended is set to 0xCCCCCCCC.

seg-source.mrk: Remarks

target.mrk: Remarks

trans-unit.source: Process names are executables without the full path, e.g., "notepad.exe" or "winword.exe"

seg-source.mrk: Process names are executables without the full path, e.g.,
"notepad.exe" or "winword.exe"

target.mrk: Process names are executables without the full path, e.g.,
"notepad.exe" or "winword.exe"

trans-unit.source: PID is the unique number which identifies a Process. A PID can be obtained through the ProcessExists() or Run() commands.

seg-source.mrk: PID is the unique number which identifies a Process.
A PID can be obtained through the ProcessExists() or Run() commands.

target.mrk: PID is the unique number which identifies a Process.
A PID can be obtained through the ProcessExists() or Run() commands.

trans-unit.source: The process is polled approximately every 250 milliseconds.

seg-source.mrk: The process is polled approximately every 250 milliseconds.

target.mrk: The process is polled approximately every 250 milliseconds.

trans-unit.source: The return is 1 if the process was not existing.

seg-source.mrk: The return is 1 if the process was not existing.

target.mrk: The return is 1 if the process was not existing.

seg-source.mrk: Related

target.mrk: Related

seg-source.mrk: Example

target.mrk: Example

trans-unit.source: Wait until no instance of Notepad exists.

seg-source.mrk: Wait until no instance of Notepad exists.

target.mrk: Wait until no instance of Notepad exists.

seg-source.mrk: notepad.exe

target.mrk: notepad.exe

trans-unit.source: Wait until this particular instance of Notepad is closed by the user.

seg-source.mrk: Wait until this particular instance of Notepad is closed by the user.

target.mrk: Wait until this particular instance of Notepad is closed by the user.

seg-source.mrk: notepad.exe

target.mrk: notepad.exe
